title: U.S. and India to expand spaceflight cooperation
summary: The governments of the United States and India have agreed to work more closely together in spaceflight, with India signing the Artemis Accords and the two countries planning for a joint mission of some kind to the International Space Station.

title: SpaceX closes record-breaking first half of 2023 with Starlink launch
summary: SpaceX’s last launch of the first half of 2023 is set for this Friday, June 23, carrying 56 Starlink v1.5 satellites. Liftoff is scheduled to occur at 9:57 AM EDT (13:57 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. A backup launch attempt is available on the same day 98 minutes later.

title: Senate Appropriators Adopt FY2024 Spending Caps
summary: The Senate Appropriations Committee adopted spending caps for its 12 subcommittees today. In most cases they are higher than their House counterparts. While that may seem like good news for […]

title: What the wreck of the Titan portends for commercial spaceflight
summary: With the loss of the submersible Titan and her five passengers garnering round-the-clock media attention, those working in the emergent private space travel industry should pay close attention

title: Virgin Galactic raises $300 million, seeks another $400 million to expand spacecraft fleet
summary: Virgin Galactic has successfully raised $300 million via an “at the market” offering of common stock, the company disclosed in a securities filing Thursday.

title: NASA Awards Contract for Earth Radar Data Operations, Management
summary: NASA has awarded a contract to the University of Alaska at Fairbanks, Alaska, for the continued development and operation of the Synthetic Aperture Radar Distributed Active Archive Center for NASA’s Earth Observing System Data and Information System.

title: SpaceX launches 47 Starlink satellites, provides unique views on Twitter
summary: 47 more Starlink satellites are now in orbit after a successful launch atop a Falcon 9 from Vandenberg Space Force Base in...

title: ESA’s BepiColombo probe conducts third flyby of Mercury
summary: The European Space Agency’s (ESA) BepiColombo spacecraft, which is in the midst of its seven-year journey to Mercury, has successfully completed its third flyby of the solar system’s innermost planet.

title: NASA's MAVEN Spacecraft Stuns with Ultraviolet Views of Red Planet
summary: NASA’s MAVEN (Mars Atmosphere and Volatile EvolutioN) mission acquired stunning views of Mars in two ultraviolet images taken at different points along our neighboring planet’s orbit around the Sun.

title: Landing in Living Rooms: LEGO Models of NASA Mars Rover and Helicopter
summary: A new STEM-themed kit developed in cooperation with NASA-JPL is designed to spark kids’ interest in engineering and space via traditional toys and augmented reality.
